page.title: 04FISHING AT NOSTELL PRIORY
page.content: One of the major pastimes in our area is fishing and a very popular place to fish is at Nostell Priory. Nostell has three lakes covering 40 acres and claims to offer some of the finest coarse fishing in Yorkshire.The lakes are surrounded by woodland and rhododendrons, providing a beautiful and peaceful setting. The lakes are well stocked with fish including roach, pike,tench, bream and perch. To fish the lakes a licence and a valid permit are required, which are obtainable from a self-employed water bailiff who is responsible for the upkeep of the lakes. His work includes keeping the lakes clean and running a fishing shop, patrolling the lakes, tree felling and general repairs and maintenance work. Despite his workload he still finds time for his own hobbies of fishing and gardening.
